subject: p17838301
History: -year-old with AMS, concern for pneumonia. Comparison is made to the patients previous study dated at 18:26. Portable upright chest film at 5:32 is submitted.
Impression: The heart remains markedly enlarged which may reflect cardiomegaly, although a pericardial effusion should also be considered. There is prominence of the perihilar vasculature but no overt pulmonary edema on the current study. Calcified diaphragmatic plaques are seen suggestive of prior asbestos exposure. No focal airspace consolidation is seen to suggest pneumonia. No pneumothorax. No pleural effusions.
